p: Additionally, as reviewed by Silva et al ( 2020), compounds 4 and 14 have already been identified as major compounds in essential oils with antiviral activity. Santolina insularis essential oil (12.7% of compound 4) presented high activity against herpes simplex type 1 and type 2, accompanied by low cytotoxicity (Logu et al. 2000). Fortunella margarita essential oil (10.3% of compound 14 in leaves and 5.5% in fruits) presented activity against avian influenza-A virus (Ibrahim et al. 2015).
